title: Making working memory work for educational psychologists
abstractText:
The aim of this grant is to provide Educational Psychologists with resources that allow them to fully appreciate the most recent developments in research on working memory and learning, and to provide dynamic assessment activities for use within their practice to aid assessment of children who may present with memory difficulties.

The project has 6 specific objectives:

  1. to create high quality information films on the role of working memory in the classroom for Educational Psychologists' continuing professional development
  2. to create online assessment tools for use by Educational Psychologists in their practice
  3. to enhance the portfolio of our partner media production company in scientific and educational film making and game development, which is one of their strategic aims for the future
  4.  to provide the investigators with a channel to create real world impact from their work
  5.  to disseminate current research developments to the educational psychology community to add to growing interest in working memory
  6.  to determine how the film resources have made an impact on continuing professional development for the educational psychology community.
